TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit WSSProfileSynch extends System.Object
public ref class WSSProfileSynch abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Handles the synchronization of user profile data in the Microsoft SharePoint Foundation user information list on each site, and the synchronization of SharePoint Foundation members' group membership in the user profile memberships. Do not use this class directly from your code; instead, use stsadm.exe.

remarks.para: Person synchronization is bidirectional. In the up direction, the SharePoint Foundation site collection membership list is pulled into the SharePoint Server user profile database to inform SharePoint Server about which users are a member of which sites and allow incremental synchronization. In the down direction, the SharePoint Server user profile database sends down replicable user profile information for all members in the site collection.
For more information about incremental or full user profile synchronization, see Person Synchronization with Window SharePoint Services.

You must associate job definitions with a service or Web application. You can also associate a job definition with a specific server. For more information about job definitions, see the class in the Microsoft SharePoint Foundation 2010 SDK

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void ClearSyncDataForContentDatabase(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPContentDatabase cdb) cil managed
Public Shared Sub ClearSyncDataForContentDatabase (cdb As SPContentDatabase)
.method public static hidebysig void ScheduleSiteForFullSynchronization(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site) cil managed
Public Shared Sub ScheduleSiteForFullSynchronization (site As SPSite)

Docs.param: A collection of sites in a Web application, including a top-level Web site and its subsites.
Docs.summary: Schedules a full synchronization of user profile data in the database with those in the Windows SharePoint Services user information list on each site. Do not use this member directly from your code; instead, use stsadm.exe.

remarks.para: The class is not intended to be used directly from your code; use stsadm.exe instead.
For more information about incremental or full user profile synchronization, see Person Synchronization with Window SharePoint Services.
For more information about the parameter, see the class in the Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 SDK.

Docs.param: The content database in the Windows SharePoint Services deployment.
Docs.summary: Handles the synchronization of user profile data in the content database. Do not use this member directly from your code; instead, use stsadm.exe.

remarks.para: The class is not intended to be used directly from your code; use stsadm.exe instead.
For more information about incremental or full user profile synchronization, see Person Synchronization with Window SharePoint Services.
For more information about the parameter, see the class in the Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 SDK.

Docs.param: The Internet Information Services (IIS) load-balanced Web application that is installed on the server farm.
Docs.summary: Handles the synchronization of user profile data in a Web Application. Do not use this member directly from your code; instead, use stsadm.exe.

remarks.para: The class is not intended to be used directly from your code; use stsadm.exe instead.
For more information about incremental or full user profile synchronization, see Person Synchronization with Window SharePoint Services.
For more information about the parameter, see the class in the Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 SDK.
